org.settings4j.objectresolver
Class AbstractObjectResolver

java.lang.Object
  org.settings4j.objectresolver.AbstractObjectResolver
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectResolver
Direct Known Subclasses:
JavaXMLBeansObjectResolver, SpringConfigObjectResolver
public abstract class AbstractObjectResolver
extends Object
implements ObjectResolver

Basic Connector implementations like getter and Setter of contentResolver, objectResolver.

Author:
Harald.Brabenetz

AbstractObjectResolver

Method Detail

addObjectResolver

public void addObjectResolver(ObjectResolver objectResolver)
Some Implementations of a ObjectResolver are delegating the functionality to other ObjectResolvers.
Examples are: UnionObjectResolver 
 --------------------------------------
 <objectResolver name="DefaultObjectResolver" class="org.settings4j.objectresolver.UnionObjectResolver">
     <objectResolver-ref ref="JavaXMLBeansObjectResolver" />
     <objectResolver-ref ref="SpringConfigObjectResolver" />
 </objectResolver>
 --------------------------------------

Specified by:
addObjectResolver in interface ObjectResolver
Parameters:
objectResolver - the original objectResolver to delegate.

getObject

public Object getObject(String key,
                        ContentResolver contentResolver)
Reads the byte[] content from the ContentResolver and creates an Object. The normal usecase of an implementation of this ObjectResolver Interface:
  1. Read the Propertyfile from ContentResolver.getContent(key + ".properties")
  2. Read the Value of "objectResolverKey" from propertyfile
  3. The "objectResolverKey" defines which ObjectResolver-Implementation should solve the byte[] content to a Java-Object
  4. Convert the byte[] from ContentResolver.getContent(String key) to an Object.
  5. Maybe additional values are consumed from the propertyfile

Specified by:
getObject in interface ObjectResolver
Parameters:
key - The Key of the byte[] who should be converted to an Object.
contentResolver - The contentResolver, from where the content could be read.
Returns:
the Object, or null if this Object-Resolver can not convert the byte[] Content to an Object.

getObjectProperties

protected Properties getObjectProperties(String key,
                                         ContentResolver contentResolver)
To get the additional Properties for the given byte[] content can be overwriten by subclasses.

The default implementation reads the PropertyFile from key + ".properties". If no property where found, or an error occurs, this method return null.

Parameters:
key - the key of the byte[] Content to convert.
contentResolver - the ContentResolver to read the additional Property-File.
Returns:
the parsed Properties Object or null if an error occurred.

public String getPropertySuffix()

getObjectResolverKey

protected String getObjectResolverKey()

contentToObject

protected abstract Object contentToObject(String key,
                                          Properties properties,
                                          byte[] content,
                                          ContentResolver contentResolver)
Method to convert the given content-File to an Object must be implemented by SubClasses.

Parameters:
key - The Original Key of the Object
properties - The Property-File which where Found under key + ".properties"
content - The byte[] Content to convert.
contentResolver - the contentResolver to get possible additional content Files.
Returns:
the parsed Object from the byte[] Content.

public boolean isCached()
